Here is a simplified version of the text, adapted for a learner of English at level A1:
'Pay for your trash? It sounds like a good idea. But it's not that simple. In many countries, people don't pay for their trash. They just put it in a bin and it gets taken away. But it's not free. The government pays for it. And the more trash people throw away, the more it costs. So, maybe we should make people pay for their trash. This way, they will throw away less and recycle more.
Some towns in the US have tried this. They make people buy a special sticker to put on their trash bags. Only the bags with the sticker get taken away. The people who did this study found that people threw away less trash. But they also found that people just put more trash in each bag. And some people didn't pay and threw their trash away in other places.
The study also found that people in richer towns throw away more trash than people in poorer towns. And people in richer towns don't have time to recycle. So, is it a good idea to make people pay for their trash? It's not that simple. We need to think about it carefully.'

'Work and Life
Theodore Zeldin thinks about how our work life can change. Are we happy with our jobs? Many people are not happy. They feel like they are just doing a job, not doing something they love. Even people who are very good at their job can feel unhappy.
Zeldin wants to find a way to make work more fulfilling. He thinks work should be a way to make us happy and fulfilled, not just a way to earn money. He wants to know how we can make our work more enjoyable and meaningful.
He looks at different jobs and sees how they affect people's lives. He talks about hotels, for example. Hotels can be more than just places to sleep. They can be like a United Nations, where people from all over the world meet and learn from each other. But many hotel workers are not happy. They are not treated well and do not have the chance to use their skills.
Zeldin thinks that work should be a relationship between people, not just a job. He wants people to be able to choose their own jobs and work with people they like. He also thinks that people should be able to talk to each other in a way that is respectful and honest. This is important because it helps us understand each other and feel like we are equal.
In short, Zeldin wants to make work a way to make us happy and fulfilled, not just a way to earn money.'

Here is a simplified version of the text, adapted for A1 level learners:
"TELEVISION: How It Started
A long time ago, "broadcasting" meant spreading seeds widely. It's not just a farming idea, but also a way to describe something new and modern. It's about sharing things with many people, like a big harvest. The idea of broadcasting uses a central point, like a big bag of seeds, to spread things out. We want to know why a new technology that sends pictures and sounds was set up in a way that used this idea.
Television is related to other ways of communicating, like the phone and the radio. But it was surprising that it was planned to be a centralised "mass" medium from the start. This made sense with the way society was organized and how people lived in the past.
Some people tried to do things differently, but it didn't work out. In the 1930s, some people in Britain tried to make two-way television, like a two-way phone. They wrote articles in magazines and built their own TV transmitters and receivers. But big companies didn't want to let them do it their way, and the idea didn't take off.
Television was also used in public places, like movie theaters, in the 1930s. It was seen as a way to compete with the film industry. In many countries, people watched TV in public places, not just at home.
The idea of people making their own TV shows or using TV in their own way was not very successful. Instead, TV was mainly used to show shows and movies to many people at the same time. This was because it was easy to sell TV sets to many people and make a lot of money.
The way TV was organized was connected to the way society was changing. As people got richer and moved to cities, they wanted to have more entertainment and culture at home. TV was a way to bring this to them. The government also wanted to use TV to reach many people with important information.
The way TV was organized was also connected to the idea of a "nation" or a country. TV was a way to bring people together and make them feel like they were part of the same group.
Now, TV is changing, and maybe the idea of "broadcasting" will change too. Maybe it will become a different way of thinking about TV in the future."

Here is the simplified text for A1 level learners:
'Clutter Sometimes we have too many things, but we never feel safe. It's okay to have some things to make our home comfortable, but sometimes we want more and more. Advertisers try to make us want things we don't really need. They make us feel bad if we don't have something. Try not to look at advertisements next time you're out. They try to make us buy things without us realizing it. We see ads on TV, radio, newspapers, magazines, and the internet. They tell us to buy, buy, buy.
Caves are interesting and mysterious. Scientists study caves to learn more about them. People have been studying caves for a long time. Some people like to visit caves for fun, and they also help scientists learn more about them.
Weather We used to watch the weather with our own eyes. Now we have special machines that help us know what the weather will be like. We get weather information quickly and easily. But we still need people to help us understand the weather. They use computers to figure out what the weather will be like, but they also need people to help them make sense of it.'

'Music and Theatre
I used to think that opera is mostly a type of theatre. But now I know it's actually more about music. This is good, because music is very important.
I used to work at an opera house and I learned that music is more important than theatre. But I come from a world where theatre is more important. In theatre, the words and the actors are the most important things. There is no one directing the action once the show starts, and the actors and the audience mostly speak the same language.
When people go to a concert or an opera, some people may not know much about music. They might feel a little embarrassed or amazed by how good the performers are. Even people who don't know much about music can appreciate the skill of the performers.
In contrast, people who go to the theatre have different expectations. They don't always understand how hard it is for actors to do their job. They might not be impressed when an actor does a long and difficult speech.
This doesn't mean that people who go to the theatre are more or less generous than people who go to concerts. It just means that the audience and the performers meet on more equal terms in the theatre.
I think music could learn something from theatre about how to connect with the audience. I've seen how a different approach can make a big difference. Music is already a very theatrical thing, full of passion, humor, and emotion. But sometimes the way we present music can make it feel too formal or hierarchical.
There are many people working to make music more accessible to everyone. I think music could be even more special if it was more like theatre, with a sense of risk and adventure. Sometimes this can happen when music is performed in unusual places, like a church or a park. This can be exciting and unexpected for both the performers and the audience.
I love both music and theatre and I want them to both be successful and enjoyable for everyone.'

Here is the simplified text for A1 level learners:
I don't like sand when it's not used to make things like glass or concrete. When it's on the beach, it gets in my face and makes a mess. It's hard to get rid of it too. But when I sit down or walk on a clean floor, it suddenly disappears. Sand is very sticky and stays with me for a long time.
People have always wanted a safe and private place to live. This is why we have locks on our doors. Even with new technology, many people still prefer to use a physical key to unlock their doors.
I was worried about visiting a modern art museum because I don't understand modern art. I like some of it, like sculptures with fur and bright lights. But I don't know what most of it means. The museum tried to help me understand the art by giving me information about each piece. This made me feel better and I could understand more of the art.

Every Picture Tells a Story
When a book is made into a movie, some things are left out. This can be frustrating for the writer, but it can also be helpful. I worked on a script and I was surprised by how much of the book I could leave out and still get the same message across.
In a book, we need to see and hear things many times to understand. But in a movie, we don't need to see and hear things so much. This is because movies are more like real life. We don't need to be told everything all the time.
Movies can be very exciting. They can take us to a different world and make us forget about our own problems. But when the movie is over, we go back to our own world and forget about the movie.
The place where movies are made is called a studio. It's a big building with many rooms. Each room is used for a different job, like writing or editing. The studio can be confusing for people who don't work there. But the people who work there know where to go.
Many people want to make movies. They can buy books about how to do it and even take classes. Some people make movies for very little money and become famous. Others take a long time to make their first movie.

'I grew up in a place called West Earlham. The houses were all the same, and they were close together. Sometimes, when it was summer, a bad smell came from a factory nearby. I remember looking out of the window and seeing the houses go on and on. My mother was a small, strict woman. She was always angry, and I didn't know why. She liked to keep things clean and tidy. She would say things like "behave properly" and "don't touch that." She had some friends who were also strict and serious. They would talk about boring things like the weather and how hard life is. My mother was very particular about how we behaved. She would get angry if we didn't do what she said. When I was little, I would play on the floor while my mother sat in an armchair. When I was five, I started going to school. My mother would send me with other children in the street. I liked the summer holidays, when we would see people who lived outside our neighborhood. I remember going to a fair once, where we got lemonade and saw a woman trying to sell us something. My mother didn't like it because she thought the woman was trying to trick us. My mother didn't like politicians because she thought they were bad. Sometimes, she would take me to the museum on Sundays. We would walk around and look at paintings. My mother wasn't very good at making jokes, but once she made one about a Roman soldier.'

Here is a simplified version of the text for a learner of level A1 on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR):
'I walked down Philadelphia Avenue on one side of the street. It was getting dark and the air was wet and misty. I knew this side of the street from when I was a child. There were many houses and shops, and I knew some of the people who lived there. The houses were not all the same, and some were even old and worn out. Over time, some shops had become homes, and some homes had become shops. This was strange and interesting.
I met a man named Rick Gilbert who lived in a big, old warehouse. He had made it into a home and a place to work. He wanted to make sure it was not too empty and open, so he put up a big piece of plastic to divide the space. This made a hallway and a kitchen in the middle of the flat.
Another person, Bruce Chatwin, was a writer who loved to travel. He wrote a book about his travels and made it sound very exciting. But sometimes he made up stories to make it more interesting. He believed that traveling could help us learn about the world and its history.
I also liked to swim in the pool behind my house. One day, I had an idea to swim all the way across Britain to the sea. I wanted to follow the rain and see where it went. Swimming is a way to escape and explore, and it can help us feel free and wild.'

The simplified text still conveys the main ideas and themes of the original passage, but uses simpler vocabulary and sentence structures to make it more accessible to a learner of level A1.

Here is the simplified text for A1 level learners:
'Charles Darwin thought that people cry for no good reason. But scientists now think that crying is important for building strong relationships with others. When we are babies, we cry to show that we need help. As we grow up, crying can be a way to show that we are sad or upset. But sometimes we cry because we are happy too. For example, we might cry when we hear beautiful music or see a sad movie. We might even cry when we see someone else being treated unfairly. Crying can be a way to show that we care about others. Some people think that crying is a way to connect with others and feel close to them. Scientists are still studying why we cry, but it's clear that crying is important for our social lives.'

"The Earth is getting warmer. This is called global warming. We don't know exactly how much warmer it will get or what will happen. But we know that a warmer climate will change the weather all over the world. This will affect plants, animals, water, and soil. Humans use these natural resources to live. We need to know what will happen and why.
Scientists have been studying the Earth's temperature for a long time. They know that human actions have increased the amount of certain gases in the air, which is linked to global temperature. These gases are building up and will continue to affect the climate.
Scientists use computers to predict what will happen in the future. They use laws of physics and chemistry to analyze temperature, pressure, and other factors. But their predictions are not exact and are slow and expensive to make.
Most people agree that the Earth will get warmer faster than it has in the past. The predictions suggest that the temperature will rise by 1-3.5 degrees Celsius by 2100. Sea levels will rise by 15-95 cm, and weather patterns will change. There will be more heatwaves, floods, and droughts.
Climate change will affect the environment and humans. It can change where animals and plants live, and how they grow. This can affect our food, water, and homes. Some areas will be affected more than others. In some places, it will be good, but in others, it will be bad.
Some scientists have found that warmer temperatures have helped some areas grow more food. But in many places, it will be bad. Rising sea levels will flood coastal areas, and many people will lose their homes and jobs. This could create many refugees. The consequences will be very serious, especially for small island nations that could disappear if the sea level rises too much."

Here is a simplified version of the text for a level A1 learner:
'Looking for a couple to go to Mars. The trip will last 501 days. The couple must be strong and healthy. They will be the first people to go to Mars if a rich man named Dennis Tito's plan works. The plan is to send a special capsule to Mars. The capsule will go high above Mars, about 160 kilometers. The spacecraft will use Mars' gravity to come back to Earth without using too much fuel. This is important because fuel is expensive. The next time Mars and Earth are close together is in 2031, so the deadline is 2018. It's a big challenge, but if they can do it, it will help with future missions. Even if they don't make it to Mars, the work they do will still be important for the future.'

Here is a simplified version of the text, adapted for learners of English at the A1 level:
"Art and Life
Art is a special kind of product that exists in the world. But because it exists, it can be hard to understand. This is because art is often seen as something separate from our everyday lives. We think of it as a painting, a book, or a building, rather than something that happens in our daily experiences.
When we look at art, we often focus on the object itself, rather than how it makes us feel or what it means to us. This can make it hard to understand the true meaning of art. Art is often put on a pedestal, making it seem separate from the rest of our lives.
But art is a part of our lives. It is something that happens in the world around us, in the things we do and see every day. To truly understand art, we need to connect it to our everyday experiences.
For example, we might enjoy a movie or a song without thinking about it as "art". But if we want to understand why we enjoy it, we need to think about how it makes us feel and what it means to us.
Many people think that art is only for special things, like museum paintings or classical music. But art can be found in many everyday things, like a beautiful sunset or a funny joke.
To understand art, we need to connect it to our everyday lives. We need to see how it is a part of our world, and how it makes us feel and think."

Here are the simplified texts for a learner of level A1:
**Text 1: Observing Lions**
Lions are big cats. They hunt together. They are very good at working together. But we thought they would be selfish. We thought they would only think about themselves. But they are not. They help each other. We have been studying lions for a long time. We wanted to know why they work together. It took a long time to find out.
**Text 2: Pop Music Review**
A band called Bedrock made a new album. It was very good. It changed the way people thought about music. The band was good at writing songs. They wrote about happy and sad things. The album had many good songs. It was a great album.
**Text 3: Extract from an Autobiography**
When I was a child, I liked stories about a wise old woman. She was very smart. She taught me that you should be kind and patient. I learned a lot from her. I also learned that it's good to be interested in things that are interesting. I like to travel, but I only like to travel to places that are interesting. I like to learn about history and culture.
**Text 4: What happens to your manuscript?**
When you write a book, you send it to a publisher. The publisher has many books to read. They try to find good books. If they like your book, they will send it to someone else to read. If they like it, they will publish it. The person who publishes your book will also think about how to sell it. They will try to make sure people buy it.

Here is the simplified text, adapted for A1 level learners:
**Advertising in Trouble**
In the early 1990s, it was a tough time for people who worked in advertising. The economy was bad, and many businesses were struggling. In the UK, the economy was declining, interest rates were high, and many people lost their jobs. It was a difficult time for everyone, including those in the advertising industry.
Advertising people are often under pressure to do their jobs well. They have to come up with good ideas and make sure they are effective. But during this time, they had to do their jobs with smaller budgets. This made it even harder for them.
Some people thought that advertising was not as important as they thought. They didn't see the results they wanted, so they didn't want to spend as much money on it. This made it difficult for advertising agencies to make a profit.
The people who work in advertising are under a lot of pressure. They have to come up with good ideas and make sure they are effective. But they also have to do it with less money. This is a big challenge for them.

* Reducing the number of complex vocabulary words
* Shortening long sentences and breaking them up into simpler ones
* Removing unnecessary details and focusing on the main ideas
* Using simpler sentence structures and grammar
* Keeping the same factual content, but presenting it in a more accessible way for A1 level learners.

"I wanted to be a chef when I was at university. My friends thought it was an unusual choice. Cooking is not an easy job. Chefs work long hours, have a lot of pressure, and don't get paid much. But I didn't care. I was unhappy at university. The work was hard and the social life was boring. I wanted to be a chef because it seemed like a serious and honest job. I also loved cooking because it made me feel happy and warm.
I remember eating at a famous restaurant and it was amazing. I wanted to learn how to cook like that. I started reading cookbooks, going to markets, and cooking for myself. I didn't care about my studies anymore.
I also learned to swim. My swimming instructor was strict, but I liked the feeling of flying through the air and being in the water.
Some people like to travel and do exciting things. They might climb mountains, sail boats, or eat strange foods. We might think they are a little strange, but they are happy doing what they love.
A writer named Jonathan likes to sail, even though he is afraid of the sea. He likes to write about his sailing adventures."

Here is a simplified version of the text, adapted for a learner of English at the A1 level (CEFR):
Summer is a great time for holidays and reading. We can escape our daily routine and explore new places. Reading books can help us feel more at home in the world. We can find our own thoughts and feelings in the stories of others. Authors can describe things in a way that we can understand. We feel grateful to them for helping us understand ourselves.
When we travel, we can learn new things and see new places. Our eyes are open to the world around us. We notice things we never noticed before. We can see the beauty of nature, the kindness of strangers, and the beauty of different cultures.
The author of this text has traveled a lot and written about his experiences. He likes to share his stories with others. He talks about his travels to different countries, including China and Transylvania. He also talks about the importance of reading and writing.

'Fashion is a modern thing that started a long time ago. People used to wear different clothes and accessories because of their jobs or where they came from. This is still true today. People wear different clothes to show who they are and where they are from. A suit, for example, can mean different things to different people. Some people think it's formal and serious, while others think it's boring and old-fashioned.
As for me, I'm a writer. I write books and articles to make a living. Some writers have other jobs too, like teaching. I've had to work part-time jobs and use credit cards to make ends meet. But I've been lucky to get help from some kind friends.
One day, my band became very popular and we started playing at big venues. People loved our music and came to see us everywhere. We had to use secret entrances to get to our gigs because there were too many fans outside. We couldn't even go out without being followed by people who loved our music. It was a big change for me and my bandmates. We were suddenly famous and people were looking after us. I felt a little shy, but also a bit proud and confident. It was a strange feeling.'

'Music in the Future
Music is an important part of our lives. We can listen to music on the radio, TV, CDs, and the internet. But some people think that the way we listen to music is changing. They think that we will hear more different types of music in the future.
In the past, people used to listen to music on the radio, TV, and records. Now, we have many more ways to listen to music. This has changed the way musicians work. Some musicians have less work now because people can listen to music at home.
Music is important for our lives. It makes us happy and helps us relax. Music is also important for our brains. Playing a musical instrument can help us think better and be more focused.
In the future, people might use technology to make music. This could make it easier for people to make music, but it might also mean that some musicians don't have jobs.
To prepare for the future, music teachers need to change the way they teach. They need to teach people of all ages how to play different instruments. This will help people make music and enjoy it.
The music profession needs to work together to make music more popular. Music is important, but sometimes we forget how much we enjoy it. Music teachers, musicians, and music lovers need to work together to make music a big part of our lives again.'

Here is the simplified text for a learner of English at the A1 level:
Actors are often criticized. Some people think they are not good at their job. But actors should not talk too much about themselves. They should just focus on their work. A famous actor, Paul Scofield, said that an actor's work is only interesting when they are performing. When they talk about their work, it becomes boring.
A review of a play says that an actor named Adrian Lester did a great job. He played the role of Hamlet and was very good. He used his body and voice to show his emotions. He was very good at making the audience feel what he was feeling.
What is acting? Is it just imitating someone or is it bringing someone to life? Who makes the actors' bodies move? These are big questions about the theater.
A director's way of working is called "dropping in". The actors sit quietly and listen to the script. When it's their turn to speak, they think about the words and what they mean. They find the reason to speak and then speak. The director wants the actors to be natural and not plan what they will do.
The perfect theater is one that makes the audience feel like they are a part of the show. The staff should be friendly and welcoming. The theater itself should be designed so that the audience can see and hear the performers well. The proportions of the theater are important. It should be big enough to fit the human body.

We invited some researchers to share their experiences and how they analyzed their data. We wanted to understand how they did it, not make a guide for new researchers.'

'I saw my six-year-old son eating noodles in a funny way. He was pulling them up with his teeth and making a "roar" sound. He was pretending to be a dinosaur. I asked him about dinosaurs and he didn't know much. Some people think that learning with a computer or TV is good, but is it really? One man tried an interactive program with his son. The father read the words and the son played with the pictures. The man thought his son might have learned something if they had read a book instead.
Television is like a movie. It's not good for learning if there is no teacher or parent to help. We need to use new technology to teach our children, but we also need schools.
Hollywood is a famous place in the United States. It's where many movies are made. A long time ago, people didn't like the movie people because they thought they were not good. But now, Hollywood is very successful.
Photography is a way to take pictures. It was invented by artists who wanted to capture their surroundings. They used special tools to take pictures that looked real. Some people didn't think photography was art, but the photographers knew it was.
Book illustrations are pictures in books. A long time ago, all children's books had pictures. Some books were very good, and some were not. Now, people are starting to appreciate the old book illustrations again. They might even make new books with the old pictures.'

Some people write about their lives on the internet. They tell the world where they are and what they are doing. But this can be a problem. It's like telling everyone your address and saying, "Come visit me!" You might not want all those people to know where you are.
A long time ago, some brave people started writing about their lives online. They showed us that it's possible to share our thoughts and feelings with others. But they also learned that it's not always a good idea. They got in trouble and lost friends.
One person, Justin Hall, started writing about his life online in 1994. He shared his thoughts, photos, and art. He wanted to be honest and open with his readers. But sometimes, being too honest can cause problems. He fell in love and wrote about it online. His girlfriend didn't like this, so he had to stop writing about his life.
Another person, Heather Armstrong, wrote about her job and her life online. But someone told her boss about her blog, and she lost her job. This is a problem that can happen when we share too much online. We might say things we wouldn't say in person, and this can cause trouble.
Heather learned from her mistake and started writing about her family and new life. She is now a famous blogger and makes money from her writing. She learned that it's important to be careful when sharing our lives online.

'Sleep is important. Many people don't sleep enough. In some countries, people are tired and worried. Scientists study sleep. They want to know why we need sleep and how we can sleep better.
One scientist did an experiment. He asked people to sleep for 14 hours a night for a month. They got used to sleeping for 8 hours a night after three weeks. This shows that people need a lot of sleep.
There is a special place where scientists study sleep. It's a laboratory at a university. They test how people sleep. They ask people to drive a car and answer questions. They want to know how sleep affects driving.
Scientists know some things about sleep. They know that people sleep every day. They know that people sleep in different stages. They know that women sleep for half an hour longer than men. They also know that older people need less sleep.
Some people think that sleep helps our bodies. Others think that sleep helps us remember things. But we don't really know for sure.
In the past, people slept differently. They would sleep for a little while, wake up, and then sleep again. This was a special time for them to think and relax. But now, most people sleep all night.
In some places, people still sleep in short periods. They don't need a whole night's sleep. This is because they have to listen for animals and watch for dangers.
So, people all around the world need sleep. We should make sure we get enough sleep.'

I wore big, expensive cowboy boots in the Arizona desert. I wanted to be a cowboy, but I wasn't one. I was a racing driver before, but I don't do that anymore. I don't know what to do now. I thought I had a plan, but it didn't work out.
I miss driving fast cars. I miss being famous. People liked me and wanted to talk to me. But now, nobody calls me. I have a lot of free time. I looked up at the sky and saw some birds. They were telling me to go away. I didn't know the desert had birds that sing!
I realized that I need to learn new things. I'm a fake cowboy in expensive boots. I have a lot to learn.

People are the most interesting things to take pictures of. A picture with someone in it is usually more interesting than one without. But taking pictures of people is also very difficult. You need to think about how they are standing, what they are doing, and how they are feeling.

When taking a picture of a group of people, don't make them stand in a straight line. Ask them to stand at different angles and distances. You can also have some people sit or kneel in front to make it easier to see their faces.
**Posing for Pictures**
People usually don't act naturally in front of a camera. They might look stiff and uncomfortable. Try to make them feel more relaxed by suggesting they do something natural, like folding their arms or putting their hands in their pockets.
**Looking at the Camera**
If you want the person in the picture to look directly at you, ask them to look into the camera lens. This will make the picture more interesting. But they might not be able to do this for long, so remind them just before you take the picture.
**Candid Shots**
Another way to take a good picture is to have the person focus on something in the picture. This can be easier for them, and you can still get a good shot. Candid shots are very interesting, and the person's expression is important.
**Faces and Gestures**
The way someone looks and the things they do with their body can tell us a lot about them. A happy child can make us smile, while a sad expression can make us feel sad. Look for natural expressions and gestures in your pictures.
**Background and Situation**
The background or situation in a picture can add interest and tell us more about the person. Try to make the background not too distracting, and make sure the person is not too small compared to the background.

**People and Places**
When taking pictures of people in a new place, try to show them against a relevant background. Use a standard or wide-angle lens and move back to get the whole scene in the picture. Ask the people to come close to the camera, and compose the picture so that they are the main focus.

Acupuncture is a very old Chinese medicine that is over 2,000 years old. It comes from a system of medicine that includes herbal medicine, massage, and exercise. Acupuncture is used to help people feel better from many different problems, like pain.
**What is Acupuncture?**
Traditional Chinese medicine believes that our body has a special energy called Qi. This energy flows through our body along special lines called meridians. When the flow of Qi is blocked or weak, we can get sick. An acupuncturist tries to find where the flow of Qi is blocked and helps to fix it.
**How Does Acupuncture Work?**
An acupuncturist uses special needles to help the flow of Qi. They might also use heat or pressure on certain points to help the flow of Qi. Some people feel a strange sensation when the needle is inserted, like a tingling or numbness.
**Pain Relief**
Acupuncture can help with many types of pain, like back pain, arthritis, and headaches. Some doctors in the West use acupuncture to help people feel better from pain.
**How Effective is Acupuncture?**
Some studies show that acupuncture can help 50-80% of people feel better from chronic pain. Acupuncturists say that it might take a few visits to feel real relief, but some people feel better after just a few visits.
**A Different Approach**
Acupuncturists look at the whole person, not just the symptoms. They want to know what is causing the pain and how it affects the person's life. This is different from Western medicine, which often focuses only on the symptoms.
**Choosing an Acupuncturist**
It's important to choose an acupuncturist who is qualified and trained. Some acupuncturists have traditional training, while others use a more scientific approach. It's a good idea to talk to a doctor before trying acupuncture.

The band is a bit different now because Tom Wilcott plays the bass guitar instead of Simon McVee, who left the band last year. Tom Simpson is the new drummer. The first two songs on the CD are fast and fun to dance to. The rest of the CD is more like their old style. These two songs might become very popular because they are very good. The singer, Rob Letchford, does a great job singing. He had to record the songs before he got sick and had to cancel their next tour. But don't worry, the concerts will be rescheduled when he feels better. This CD shows that Moonshine can make many different kinds of music, from slow songs to fast and fun ones. I think they put their best songs at the beginning and the last few songs are not as good. But "Here again" is going to be a big hit and make the band very successful.'

Here is the simplified text for learners of English at the A1 level:
'San Francisco is a city on the west coast of the United States. A long time ago, a Spanish explorer named Gaspar de Portola found the area. He saw it in 1769. San Francisco Bay is a nice place to dock boats, but it was discovered by walking, not by boat. In 1849, many people came to San Francisco looking for gold. Some people got rich, but not the ones who looked for gold. The richest people made money from banks and law offices. They built big houses on a hill. This hill is called Nob Hill. Now, people visit San Francisco because they can see famous places like Chinatown and the Golden Gate Bridge. Some people also take a short boat trip to an island to see an old prison.'

Here is a simplified version of the text, suitable for learners at level A1 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR):
'SAMUEL PEPYS
Samuel Pepys wrote a famous diary. It's about his daily life in England from 1660 to 1669. He tells us about big news, like when people got sick, a foreign navy came to the River Thames, and a big fire in London. He also writes about himself, like when he fell asleep in church or looked at pretty girls. He talks about his home life, like when he argued with his wife and how they became friends again. He worries about her being sick. Samuel Pepys liked books, music, the theatre, playing cards, and having fun with friends. He was a busy man with many important jobs. He was a politician and worked for the navy.'

'Long time ago, people didn't care about shoes being comfortable or pretty. They wore animal skins on their feet to keep warm. We still use leather today, but now we also use other materials like silk, plastic, or cotton. It's only been 150 years since people started wearing different shoes on each foot. Before that, people wore the same kind of shoe on both feet. Shoes used to be made by hand, but now most are made in big factories. Machines help make many shoes, so we can buy cheaper shoes for more people.'

'I hurt my back and couldn't run anymore. I decided to help more women start running. I wanted to show them how fun it is and help them feel brave enough to go for a run. I started a running group for women in my area because I was unhappy with how some race organizers treated them. They said there were not enough women running, but they didn't help make it easy for them. I put up posters and 40 women joined. They were all different ages and fitness levels. They wanted to lose weight, but they didn't know much about running. They thought it would be hard and painful. But I wanted them to think about running in nice places, like by a river, and having fun with friends. At first, they only ran for one minute. Now they can run for thirty minutes. They've also learned about healthy eating and exercise from other runners. I'm happy to see them improve - almost as happy as they are!'

'A LONG TIME AGO, PEOPLE CAME TO ALASKA TO FIND GOLD. A TOWN CALLED IDITAROD GREW FAST. BUT IN WINTER, IT WAS HARD TO GET TO THE TOWN BECAUSE THE RIVERS AND OCEAN FROZE. SO, PEOPLE BUILT A PATH FOR DOGS TO PULL SLEDS. THE DOGS TOOK FOOD, MAIL, AND CLOTHES TO THE MINERS. IT TOOK THEM THREE WEEKS TO GET THERE. THEY STOPPED AT PLACES CALLED 'ROADHOUSES' FOR THE NIGHT. THE PATH WAS USED FOR A LONG TIME, BUT THEN PLANES BECAME A BETTER WAY TO TRAVEL. BUT THE DOGS HAD ONE LAST JOB. IN 1925, A BAD DISEASE CALLED DIPHTHERIA SPREAD IN A CITY CALLED NOME. THE CLOSEST MEDICINE WAS FAR AWAY, SO DOGS WERE USED TO BRING IT. IT TOOK 20 TEAMS OF DOGS SIX DAYS TO GET THERE. A DOG NAMED BALTO WAS VERY BRAVE AND HELPED SAVE THE TEAM. NOW, PEOPLE HAVE A RACE EVERY YEAR FROM ANCHORAGE TO NOME, FOLLOWING THE SAME PATH. IT'S CALLED THE IDITAROD AND IS CALLED 'THE LAST GREAT RACE ON EARTH'.'

'In Sweden, there is a special hotel made of ice. It's in a place called Jukkasjarvi, where it can get very cold. -40 degrees Celsius is not uncommon! But many people visit this hotel every year. You can eat, drink, and sleep in the ice hotel. You can even get married there! The bar is made of ice too, but you should not put hot drinks on it. The bedrooms are a bit cold, but you get special sleeping bags to keep warm. If you need, you can also borrow warm clothes. The hotel is rebuilt every winter because it melts in the summer. It takes a lot of ice and snow to build it: 10,000 tonnes of ice and 30,000 tonnes of snow.'

'Maria Mutola played football with boys in Mozambique. She was the only girl. They won a game, but the other team didn't like it because Maria was a girl. A man named Jose saw her and thought she was fast. He wanted to help her run instead of play football. He gave her special shoes and took her to train. Maria's parents didn't want her to leave, but Jose said it would help them have more food. Maria went to the United States to train. She was the only one from her country. The other girls were good at sports, but they worried about clothes and makeup. Maria worried about her parents having food. She was happy to be there and learned a lot. Now, Maria still runs and lives with her mother in South Africa.'

'The Grand Canyon in the United States is very big and very old. The River Colorado made it. People go to the Grand Canyon to walk, run and look at the view. The view is very nice. The Skywalk is special. It's a platform made of glass. You can see the rocks from the canyon from it. Not too many people can be on it at the same time. It opened in 2007. Many people have gone there since then. You have to wear special shoes to protect the glass. Walking on the Skywalk feels like you're flying high up in the air.'

'THE ROCKIES The Rocky Mountains are very long and run from north to south in North America. They start in the northwest, but are close to the middle in some parts. The Rockies are not as big as the Alps, but they are still very beautiful. There are many roads across the Rockies, but the best way to see them is by train. You can start your journey in Vancouver, a big city in Canada. Vancouver is a great place to live because you can ski just 15 minutes from the city. You can take a train from Vancouver to the other side of the country. There are not as many trains as before, but it's still a fun adventure. You can sleep on the train and see beautiful views at night.'

'Zoos People kept animals in zoos a long time ago. In China, the rulers built a big zoo called the Gardens of Intelligence. In the past, animals performed for visitors. Now, people think it's important for animals to be in their natural homes. Most cities have a zoo or a wildlife park. Some people think zoos are good because we can learn about animals and see them up close. Others don't like zoos because they think it's wrong to keep animals in cages. They also think some zoos are dirty and give animals bad food.'

'I play the trumpet in my school jazz band. Last month, we had a competition with other schools. We wore the same black uniforms and played very well. Some bands wore bright clothes, but we all played well. We even made up new songs on stage! It was fun to watch and even more fun when we played. Not everyone can join our band, but those who want to play go to practice before school and after school. We also go to special music camps. Some adults are surprised that young people like jazz. My teacher thinks it's because pop music is not challenging enough. I like jazz because it's new and old at the same time. I can make my own music and feel like I'm part of its history. My school is lucky to have good teachers and parents who support us.'

Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A1 (CEFR):
"It rains in Marrakesh, Morocco, from November to March. But it doesn't rain very often. When it does, the city's pipes get too much water and the streets flood. People are happy when it rains because it doesn't happen often. Marrakesh has parks and gardens because of special underground channels that bring water from the mountains all year round. These channels were built a long time ago, in the 11th century. Places that get their water like this are called oases. Further south, in Skoura, people use the water to grow food in small squares. The Atlas mountains are very pretty in the winter, with snow on them."

'Gareth Ellis is 13 years old. He lives with his parents, Alan and Kath. Alan is an engineer and Kath is a teacher. Gareth's brothers work in a bank and with computers. But Gareth wants to be a clown. When Gareth was three, his parents took him to the circus. He loved it and wanted to be a clown. Three years ago, his parents lost their jobs. They decided to join the circus to find new work. They both got jobs with a big circus and Gareth started training to be a clown. He calls himself Bippo. They travel with the circus in the summer and go home in the winter. Gareth's brothers take care of their house when they are away. It was hard for Kath and Alan to leave their old house, but they are happy now. Gareth misses taking long baths at home. People ask about Gareth's school, but he still learns with teachers who travel with the circus. He has a computer and does his schoolwork like everyone else. He hasn't fallen behind his friends. Gareth wants to be the main clown in a circus one day, maybe in Bippo's circus.'

'Eighteen News is a news agency for young people. Our members are between 8 and 18 years old. We collect news and write stories. We send these to newspapers, TV, radio, and websites. You can read or listen to our stories on our website. We have three places in the country where young people can meet and work on projects. We want to open more places soon. Since we started in 1994, over 2,500 young people have joined us. Sophie is one of them. She says, "I joined Eighteen News when they interviewed me for a story about hip hop music. I was amazed by the opportunities. Age doesn't matter, we work together. I learned a lot and got a job at 19. Now I work for a big news website."
When you join Eighteen News, you'll learn and work with others. You'll decide who writes each news story. We share skills between members. Older members help teach new members. We have special training sessions three times a year. If you want to join, call Director Den Ley at 01622 657874. You can join Eighteen News if you can read and write a little bit. It's free and there's no test to join.'

'Welcome to our website! We take tourists on a special flight over Antarctica. The flight is 12 hours long. We fly from Sydney, Australia, to Antarctica and back. We don't know the exact dates for next year yet, but if you book now, your money is safe.
Q: How long is the flight?
A: The flight is 12 hours.
Q: What do we see on the flight?
A: We see the sea ice and icebergs after four hours. We spend four hours over Antarctica and then fly back.
Q: Can I see penguins and other animals?
A: We don't see them well because they live far below us. We don't land on Antarctica. You need to go on a boat to see them.
Q: Can I take pictures?
A: Yes, you can take all the pictures you want. We even have special photo opportunities on the plane.
Q: Will I have a window seat?
A: Yes, you will have a window seat for half the flight. You can also get up and move around to see the sights better.'

'Some children go to a special cooking class on Saturdays. They are between 10 and 15 years old. The class is very popular, so there is a waiting list of 30 children who want to join. The class is PS280 for the whole course. The children learn how to make good food and have fun. One of the children, Bill, is 10 years old. He likes cooking because he can make food better than his mum now. The teachers are nice and make the children laugh. Flora is 12 years old. She likes cooking, but she had some trouble with onions. She made a meal for her friends and they liked it. Her mum suggested she take up cooking as a hobby. Flora is happy she decided to join the class. Their teacher, Philippe, says it's fun and children pay attention and remember things better than adults. He thinks it's good to teach children how to cook when they are young, so they can make their own food when they leave home.'

'Winter Driving
Winter driving is not easy. It's hard to know what will happen and accidents can happen quickly. Fog can come suddenly on a hill. Ice can be hidden under snow, and a car can slide on it. 
To drive safely on icy roads, remember these two rules:
1. Drive slowly and smoothly. Don't make sudden movements. Imagine you have a cup of hot coffee in the car. Drive carefully so you don't spill it.
2. Look ahead and be prepared for what might happen. On icy roads, you need to look further ahead than usual. Test how long it takes to stop by gently pressing the brakes. Remember, you might be going faster than you think. 
Always keep control of your car and you will be safe.'

"Craigie Aitchison was a Scottish painter. He went to art school in London. He didn't like the traditional drawing classes, but he kept painting. When he was older, the Italian government gave him money to study art. He liked the colors and light in Italy and wanted to put this in his paintings. He paints colors one on top of another, but he's not sure what the result will be. He says, 'It's a secret - because I don't know myself.' He doesn't draw before he starts painting. He changes his paintings many times before they are finished. He likes to paint people who don't want to see their pictures while he's painting them. If they ask to see the painting, he can't do it. He doesn't follow any painting traditions. He just paints the way he can. His work is liked by many young British painters."

Here is a simplified version of the text for a learner of level A1:
'Two years ago, my 14-year-old son, Ben, wanted a drum set for his birthday. We were worried about the noise, but Ben said it was better than watching TV or playing video games. He promised it would keep him out of trouble. We agreed, but told him to think about the rest of the family and our neighbours when he plays. 
Now, Ben's friends come over with their guitars and other instruments. The house gets noisy, and we can't stay home. But it's good for us because we go for a walk when they practice. The music might not be my taste, but the boys are nice and friendly. They play in local clubs for young people. We're worried they won't focus on their schoolwork because of music, but it hasn't happened yet. I always remind Ben how important his studies are. But one thing is sure - Ben was right: it keeps him out of trouble and he's never bored.'

'Atlantic College I went to visit Atlantic College in Wales. It's a special school that helps students learn and grow. The students are between 16 and 18 years old and come from many countries. They study in the morning and then do a fun activity in the afternoon. This could be helping on a farm, taking care of people who need help, or checking the rivers for pollution. What's great about Atlantic College is that the students come from different countries and backgrounds. Some students can't afford the fees, so the school gives them a grant. Many students are from the UK and get help from the government. One student from the Netherlands said, "I like this school because it helps us learn to get along with people from different countries." She said she didn't argue with her sister as much after she went to Atlantic College. Overall, Atlantic College is a great school that helps students learn and grow.'

Here is the simplified text at A1 level:
'I'm 32 and I just finished my first year at university. I have to read a lot and write long papers. I went back to school after 14 years. I was a secretary, but it was boring. I wasn't using my brain much. I was unhappy and jealous of students who were happy and excited about their studies. Now I'm a student, but it's hard for me to talk to my classmates. They think I'm a teacher and ask me questions I don't know. I also feel different from the teachers because I know less than them. But I'm glad I'm studying. It's important to have a good job. I prefer to read on the weekends, not go to parties. I like the student benefits, like long holidays and discounts on movies and theater. Sometimes I worry about what I'll do after I finish university, but I think it was a good choice.'

'Henry Ford was born on a farm in Michigan in 1863. He didn't like farming. When he was 15, he started working as a mechanic. In 1893, he built his first car. He drove it a lot, then sold it and built two more. In 1903, he started a car company. He made cars from strong but light steel, so they were cheap for ordinary people to buy. In 1908, he made the first Ford Model T. It was very popular and cost $825. Soon, he was selling 100 cars every day. By 1927, his company was worth a lot of money. His early cars were simple and cheap, but sometimes this meant there weren't many choices. Henry Ford said, "You can have any color you like, as long as it's black."'

Yours,
Maria Gonzalez

David May'

Here is the simplified text for A1 level learners:
'REBECCA STEVENS Rebecca Stevens was the first woman to climb Mount Everest. Before she climbed the mountain, she was a journalist and lived in a small flat in London. In 1993, Rebecca left her job and her family and went to Asia with some friends who like to climb mountains. She found that climbing Everest was very difficult. 'I had to carry everything I needed on my back,' she said. 'I could only take what was really important. I didn't even take a toothbrush! There was no water on the mountain, only snow. We only took enough water to drink.'
Rebecca reached the top of Mount Everest on May 17, 1993. It was the best moment of her life. After that, she became famous. She wrote a book about her trip and people often ask her to talk about it. She now works on a TV show about science. Rebecca is well-known now and has more money, but she still lives in her little flat in London with her pictures and books about mountains!

"Dear Mike,
I'm sorry you couldn't come to my party yesterday. Jon told me you were feeling very sick and stayed in bed. Are you better now?
My party was very good. Many of my friends came and gave me nice presents. I will tell you more about it on Monday. See you then!
Love, Lorenzo"

'Canada Geese are big birds with blue and white feathers. In the autumn, they fly to a warmer place because it's too cold in Canada. Last year, Bill Lishman found 16 baby Canada Geese on his farm. Their parents were not there. Bill thought, 'These little birds won't know what to do when autumn comes.' Bill had a small plane and decided to teach the birds to follow him. He took them on short flights all summer. When autumn came, Bill flew to Virginia, 600 miles away from his home. The geese followed him all the way. Bill left the geese in Virginia and went back home. This spring, Bill waited for the birds to come back. They didn't come, so Bill went to Virginia to find them. He looked for two weeks, but couldn't find them. When he got home, the geese were waiting for him. They had found their way home by themselves!'

'ESTHER'S STORY
Esther was 16 when she left school. Her aunt gave her some money for her birthday. Most of her friends went to college, but Esther used the money to start her own business. She bought fruit, sugar, and jars and made jam. She sold the jam to her friends for 1 pound each. She soon had double the money her aunt gave her.
Esther's parents didn't want her to make jam. They thought she should study to be a teacher or doctor. But Esther didn't listen. She kept making jam. After a few months, she started selling it at the market. Then she made orange juice. She sold it to a school where one of her friends worked.
After two years, Esther's business was very big. Her parents were happy with her. She made many foods and sold them to shops and supermarkets. She was very busy and had to get help from others.'

'Corryvale Farm is in England. Stephen and Jenny Blackler have cows, chickens, and sheep. They sell milk, eggs, and wool. Jenny has 50 sheep. She takes their wool to make sweaters and socks. She started making socks five years ago. People liked them because they were cheap, strong, and easy to wash. Now, Jenny makes socks at a factory. There are many colours, sizes, and types of socks for different people. Jenny is very busy at Christmas because people like to give Corryvale socks as presents. Jenny gets many nice letters from happy customers all over the world.'

Maria'

"Burglars like the afternoon. Most burglaries happen between 2 pm and 6 pm, say the police. Inspector Ian Saunders told us that there are more burglaries now than last year. He said that 67% of burglaries happen when people forget to close a door or window. He said that burglars like winter afternoons because it is dark and they can't be seen. Many people are not at home at this time because they are still at work. Inspector Saunders said it's a good idea to leave lights on when you go on holiday. This will help keep burglars away. He also asked neighbors to watch each other's houses when people are not at home. If they see something strange, they should call the police. Inspector Saunders said we will also teach you how to make your house safe. This help is free."

'Dear Lynne and Tony, I want to say thank you for letting me stay in your home for two nights. It was nice to see you again. Here are the photos of your children that you asked for. I think they are good photos, don't you? I like my new camera very much. Next week, I will visit my sister in New York. I will take many photos there too. I haven't seen my sister for a long time. Thank you again. Love, Roy'

'A long time ago, people went to the forest to find food. They moved around to find plants and fruit to eat. But 12,000 years ago, people started to grow their own food in the Middle East. This was the beginning of farming. Farming allowed people to stay in one place and live in bigger groups. Some people could then do other jobs, like making clothes. But sometimes, farming was hard when the weather was bad. Now, farmers can grow a lot of food and send it to our homes, even from far away.'

'WORKING FOR AN AIRLINE
Nicola Peet left school at 18 and went to college. Then she worked at a local airport. After 9 months, she got a job with Saudi Arabian Airlines and later with British Airways. Now she is a manager. Here's what she told us about her job:
'I work at Heathrow Airport. I'm in the air 60% of the time. I teach air hostesses and help them with problems. I also go to meetings. My work hours are usually from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., but sometimes I work from 1 p.m. to 9 p.m. First, I check flight times on my computer and talk to air hostesses. Sometimes I go on long flights to check on air hostesses. I like this part of my job. I also like office work. But traveling can be tiring. After a long journey, I just want to eat and sleep. I don't earn a lot of money, but I'm happy with British Airways and want to stay.'

'The weather is important for many people. Farmers need to know the weather to do their job. A long time ago, farmers looked at the sky, animals, and plants to understand the weather. For example, if the sky is red in the evening, it might be sunny the next day. Some people think that when cows lie down in the fields, it might rain soon.'

'Two friends, Frazer and Peter, are 14 years old. They live in the same small town in Canada. They like to play together. They used to go fishing and swimming, but now they work on Peter's computer. They are making a new game. The idea came from Frazer's little brother, Kevin. Kevin has trouble reading. He learns better with pictures and sounds. Frazer and Peter worked hard for 200 hours to make the game. It's a game where you see a picture and hear a word. For example, if you see a picture of a hat, you hear "Hat! Hat!". They won some prizes and soon their game will be sold all around the world. Many schools want to buy it.'

'HOW DO THE IRISH POP-GROUP 'BOYZONE' LIVE A HEALTHY LIFE? 
Sleeping is important. When I go home to my mom's house, I sleep for a long time. But it's hard for me to sleep after a concert because I think about the music. 
I like sports. Before I had an accident, I went to the sports centre every day. Now I do sit-ups every day. I don't drink alcohol or smoke. I try to eat healthy food. I also drink a lot of water. It's good for my body. 
It's important to have free time. I like my job, but I also like listening to music or watching TV. Sometimes it's good to do nothing. 
I feel better since my doctor told me to eat better. Now I eat more fruits and vegetables. But I still like eating burgers sometimes!'

'Bollywood is the name of the film industry in Mumbai, India. It makes many films every year. Since it started making films in 1913, Bollywood has made over 29,000 films. This is a lot more than the USA. Most Indians like watching films. Ten million Indians go to the cinema every day. Bollywood films are romantic and have singing and dancing. People like watching Indian films not just in India, but also in other countries. Last year, Bollywood sold its films to other countries and earned over $500 million. Indian actors make more films than American actors, but they don't earn as much money. That's why Bollywood films are cheap to make. A Hollywood film is never made for less than $5 million. Most Bollywood actors are young and work hard, but not for long. One famous actor, Amitabh Bachchan, is different. He has been acting for almost 40 years and has been in over 140 films.'

'I am Bill Bryson. I was born in the United States. I wrote books about England. My family and I lived in England for 20 years. We had a nice time there. Now we live in the United States again. My children are learning about life in the United States. They will be happy because they lived in two countries. I like England, but I want to stay here for a little while longer. My daughter will go to college soon. I went back to England for six weeks. I worked on a radio show about English and talked about my new book. Most writers don't like doing this, but I do. I like visiting new places and meeting people. It was different from my life in the United States. In England, people drove me around and I stayed in nice hotels. It was good because I didn't have to pay any bills. Everyone was kind to me and it was fun.'

'Schnauzer Dogs There are three kinds of Schnauzer dogs. The two smaller kinds came to England a long time ago. The big Schnauzer came recently. The big Schnauzer is very tall - 65 to 67.5 cm high. All Schnauzers have long hair that needs to be cut often. Most small Schnauzers are grey, but the big one is usually black. Schnauzers come from Germany. They help farmers with their sheep and are also used by the police. Schnauzers are very smart. They make good family dogs. They are friendly and good with children.'

'Mary is a student in England. She had a great summer holiday. She went to the Ruwenzori Mountains in Africa with 15 friends. They went to help build a road through a forest between two towns.

'Parrots You may have seen these pretty birds with their bright colours and long tails. They live in countries like Brazil, Australia, and India. Parrots often live in big groups. 'There are five kinds of rhino. Some live in Africa, in open fields. Others live in forests in Asia. Rhinos are big and heavy. Their skin is hard and they don't have much hair. Rhinos walk slowly. They can run fast, too - 50 kilometers per hour! Rhinos are quiet and calm. They eat grass and plants. Baby rhinos are born after 15 months in their mother's tummy. When they are born, they weigh 40 kilos. Adult rhinos are much bigger and can live for 50 years.'

'THE HISTORY OF THE LONDON POLICE
A long time ago, there were no police in London. Some old men walked around at night to keep the city safe. They didn't get paid much. London was a big city, but it was dirty and many people were poor. There were a lot of thieves, so people stayed at home. Then, a man named Henry Fielding started paying some people to stop thieves. They were like police and worked near Bow Street. Later, there were many more of them. But London got even bigger and needed more police. So, in 1829, the first London police force was created with 3000 officers. Most of them walked, but a few rode horses. Until 1920, all police officers were men. Today, London police are well paid, and the police officers who ride horses get even more money.'

'Fishing on the Ice If you drive north from Toronto for three hours, you will reach Lake Nipissing. In the winter, the lake freezes over and many Canadian fishermen come to fish here every weekend. They build little houses on the ice and paint them bright colours. They sit inside and wait for the fish to swim up to their lines. Bob Marvisch has been coming here for twenty-five years. 'You need warm but light clothes: two pairs of socks, gloves, and a warm jacket. It's easy to catch the fish,' he says. 'First, you break the ice and make a small hole. Then you put a fishing line in the hole and into the water. When the fish eat the bread, you pull the line up. The fish are small, about ten to twenty centimetres long. 'I went to Thailand with my family last summer. We went to a park near our hotel. The park had nice flowers, but we wanted to see the elephant show. We went to a big square with seats. We gave the elephants bananas for lunch. Twenty years ago, elephants worked in the forest. Now, they live in special places where people can visit them.'

They like to live in open spaces where they can see far and catch other animals. All cats need good eyes to find food. They also need to be fast and strong.'

'Otters Otters live near rivers. They build their homes from small pieces of wood. At night, they come out of their homes. Otters are very good swimmers. They can swim fast, over 10 kilometres an hour. Otters have thick brown hair. This keeps them warm in the water. Otters can close their ears and nose. This helps them stay underwater for a few minutes. A long time ago, there were few otters in Great Britain. The water was dirty and many fish and insects died. Otters didn't have enough food. People like to send postcards to their friends and family. They often have pictures of nice places like beaches, mountains, or castles. You can write a message on the back. Many people send postcards when they are on holiday because they are cheap and the pictures are nice. The first postcard was sent a long time ago, in the 1800s. It had a picture of a town by the sea. People liked them because they didn't have pictures in their newspapers then.'

There were many different kinds of dinosaurs. Some were very small, and others were very big. The biggest ones were the biggest animals that ever lived on land. The Brontosaurus was 20 metres long and ate plants. The Tyrannosaurus Rex was not as big, but it was strong and had sharp teeth for eating meat. It could also run fast because it had long legs.'

'Bears Bears can be dangerous. Adult bears are very strong and can hurt people. They are good at climbing trees and running fast. But they can't see well. They find food using their noses, like most animals. There are seven kinds of bears. The biggest is the polar bear, which is almost three meters tall. There are two kinds of black bears. One lives in North America and the other in South-East Asia. But not all black bears are black. Some are dark brown or reddish brown. Everyone loves the black and white panda bear, which comes from China. There aren't many pandas in the forest because it's hard to find food.'
